name: "The Flash"- 2.13 "Welcome to Earth-2" Online Trivia | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which DC comics character, who had her own show on the air at the same time, crossed over on "The Flash" for the first time?
questions.explanation:
Supergirl.

	The show "Supergirl" was in its first season, while this was a season 2 episode of "The Flash". Both characters were based on DC comics. Melissa Benoist played Supergirl in the episode and on the series bearing her name. Her appearance was a blink and you'll miss it event. For Benoist it was an uncredited cameo appearance.

questions.text: Killer Frost was one of the Earth-2 villains in the episode. Which Earth-1 person had the evil doppelganger?
questions.explanation:
Caitlin Snow.

	Caitlin Snow is a key member of The Flash's support staff. She is played by Danielle Panabaker in the series. When several of the people from Earth-1 crossed over to Earth-2, they met up with an evil version of Caitlin instead of her regular cheery self. Many of the doppelgangers were mirror images of the characters viewers were used to. Some of the characters didn't exist or were already dead in the other universe.

questions.text: Just before crossing over to Earth-2, Barry told Caitlyn to give them how many days to return before closing the breach?
questions.explanation:
2 days.

	Barry Allen, AKA The Flash, told Caitlyn to give him, Harrison and Cisko 48 hours to return. After that she was to assume that Zoom had captured them and to close the breach between the two different Earths.

questions.text: Who was Barry's wife on Earth-2?
questions.explanation:
Iris West.

	Iris West was Barry's adoptive sister on Earth-1, and despite him pining over her, they never dated. On Earth-2, Iris was a police detective married to Barry. This caused Earth-1 Barry some discomfort when pretending to be Earth-2 Barry.

questions.text: What career did Joe West have on Earth-2?
questions.explanation:
Lounge singer.

	Joe and Barry were great friends after Joe had raised Barry on Earth-1. In the alternate universe though, the pair hated each other. They referred to each other as Bartholomew and Joseph. Rather than becoming a detective like he had on Earth-1, Joseph was a lounge singer.

questions.text: Which main character's Earth-2 doppelganger died?
questions.explanation:
Joe West.

	Following an attack by Caitlyn and Ronnie's evil doubles, Joseph West was hospitalized. Barry (Still pretending to be Bartholomew) promised to take care of Iris and then Joseph died.

questions.text: While Barry was off on Earth-2, which metahuman was attacking Earth-1?
questions.explanation:
Geomancer.

	Geomancer has the ability cause small Earthquakes. For days he attacked parts of Central City, demanding a showdown with The Flash. Finally Jay Garrick agreed to take a substance called Velocity 6, which would temporarily give him the speed of The Flash. He then had a showdown with Geomancer on Earth-1.

questions.text: Zoom joined the fight at the end of the episode and killed Barry Allen.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Zoom did show up and stop the fight between his own minions and The Flash. When he realized his people were trying to kill Barry rather than capture him, Zoom killed two of his own henchmen. He left Killer Frost alive and ran off with Barry.

questions.text: Zoom had Harrison Wells' daughter locked up in the same jail as several other characters. What was her name?
questions.explanation:
Jesse.

	Jesse Quick, another speedster from the comics, has been imprisoned by Zoom for the entire second season of the show. Within the continuity of the show, it hasn't been revealed if Jesse has speed powers or not, though with a name like hers and her history in the comics, it's hard to imagine her not having similar powers to Barry.

questions.text: John Wesley Shipp made a tiny cameo in the episode. Rather than playing Henry Allen, he appeared as which costumed crime fighter?
questions.explanation:
The Flash.

	Shipp played Barry Allen in the 1990 live-action show also called "The Flash". He has played Henry Allen, Barry's dad, periodically in the new series. When running through the dimensions to Earth-2 Shipp's version of The Flash could be seen briefly.
